component.name: Checkbox
component.description: Allow the user to select or deselect one or more independent options.

useCases: Multiple independent selections from a list
Accepting terms or toggling a boolean preference
Batch selection in tables or lists
Filter controls with multiple active criteria

commonPatterns.name: labeled-checkbox
commonPatterns.description: Standard checkbox with a label inside a Field
commonPatterns.composition:
<Field orientation="horizontal">
  <Checkbox id="terms" />
  <FieldContent>
    <FieldLabel htmlFor="terms">Accept terms</FieldLabel>
    <FieldDescription>You agree to our Terms of Service.</FieldDescription>
  </FieldContent>
</Field>

commonPatterns.name: checkbox-group
commonPatterns.composition:
<FieldSet>
  <FieldLegend>Notifications</FieldLegend>
  <FieldGroup>
    <Field orientation="horizontal">
      <Checkbox id="email" />
      <FieldLabel htmlFor="email">Email</FieldLabel>
    </Field>
    <Field orientation="horizontal">
      <Checkbox id="sms" />
      <FieldLabel htmlFor="sms">SMS</FieldLabel>
    </Field>
  </FieldGroup>
</FieldSet>

antiPatterns.reason: On/off toggles imply immediate effect; checkbox implies deferred action
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Switch for system enablement toggles

antiPatterns.scenario: Selecting exactly one option from a set
antiPatterns.reason: Checkboxes allow multiple selections; single-select needs radio semantics
antiPatterns.alternative: Use RadioGroup for mutually exclusive choices

antiPatterns.scenario: User must search through many options
antiPatterns.reason: Checkbox lists do not scale well for large option sets

parentConstraints: Should be wrapped in a Field component when used in forms

interactions.click: Toggles between checked and unchecked states

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Space to toggle; Tab to navigate between checkboxes
accessibility.screenReader: Announces checked/unchecked state and associated label
accessibility.focusManagement: Visible 3px focus ring on focus-visible; ring color follows ring token

rules: Each checkbox represents an independent choice
Checkboxes may be part of a group or used individually
Always pair with a label for accessibility
Checkbox does not imply immediate effect â€” use Switch for that

aiHints.context: Use Checkbox for independent boolean selections. Do not use for system on/off toggles (use Switch) or mutually exclusive choices (use RadioGroup). Checkbox does not imply immediate effect. Always wrap in a Field with a label when used in forms.
